Object.Name: LPWAN Mesh Statistics
Object.Description1: The uCIFI LPWAN Mesh Statistics object enables the client to collect statistical information specifically tailored to monitor performance of 805.15.4 mesh networks. The object encompasses resources that provide visibility over both MAC layer and Network Layer statistics, the applicability of which is dependent on the specific 802.15.4 technology.

Item.Name: Tx Packets Total
Item.Description: IEEE 802.15.4 macTxSuccessCount, Packets transmitted and acked with no retries.

Item.Name: Tx Success on single Retry
Item.Description: IEEE 802.15.4 macRetryCount, successful transmission after one retry.

Item.Name: Tx Success on Multi Retry
Item.Description: IEEE 802.15.4 macMultipleRetryCount, TX acked after more than one retry.

Item.Name: Tx Discarded packets
Item.Description: Total number of packets that failed transmission.

Item.Name: TX CCA failures
Item.Description: Total number of packets that failed to transmit due to busy channel.

Item.Name: Tx ACK failure
Item.Description: Total number of packets that failed to transmit due to lack of acknowledgement.

Item.Name: Rx Packets Total
Item.Description: Total number of packets received.

Item.Name: Rx Discarded Packets
Item.Description: Total number of packets discarded.

Item.Name: Rx Malformed Packets
Item.Description: Total number of packets that failed to parse due to inconsistencies on frame headers.

Item.Name: Rx Unsecure Packets
Item.Description: Total packets discarded due to inconsistencies on security information (802.15.4 macSecurityFailure).

Item.Name: Rx duplicate Packets
Item.Description: Total number of duplicate packets droped (802.15.4 macDuplicateFrameCount).

Item.Name: Beacon Frames Sent
Item.Description: Used as a cumulative counter to report on the number of IEEE 802.15.4 Beacons frames transmitted by the device. These are used for mesh network management operations (advertising, discovery, etc.).

Item.Name: Beacon Frames Received
Item.Description: Used as a cumulative counter to report on the number of IEEE 802.15.4 Beacons frames received by the device. These are used for mesh network management operations (advertising, discovery, etc.).

Item.Name: Ack Frames Sent
Item.Description: Used as a cumulative counter to report on the number of IEEE 802.15.4 Acknowledgment frames transmitted by the device.

Item.Name: Ack Frames Received
Item.Description: Used as a cumulative counter to report on the number of IEEE 802.15.4 Acknowledgment frames received by the device.

Item.Name: Command Frames Sent
Item.Description: Used as a cumulative counter to report on the number of IEEE 802.15.4 Command frames transmitted by the device. These maybe used for mesh network management operations (association, disassociation, beacon request, etc.).

Item.Name: Command Frames Received
Item.Description: Used as a cumulative counter to report on the number of IEEE 802.15.4 Command frames received by the device. These maybe used for mesh network management operations (association, disassociation, beacon request, etc.).

Item.Name: Data Frames Sent
Item.Description: Used as a cumulative counter to report on the number of IEEE 802.15.4 Data frames transmitted by the device.

Item.Name: Data Frames Received
Item.Description: Used as a cumulative counter to report on the number of IEEE 802.15.4 Data frames received by the device.

Item.Name: Data Bytes Sent
Item.Description: Total number of payload data bytes sent via this interface.

Item.Name: Data Bytes Received
Item.Description: Total number of payload data bytes received via this interface.

Item.Name: Unicast Packets Sent
Item.Description: Count of Unicast Packets Sent.

Item.Name: Unicast Packets Received
Item.Description: Count of Unicast Packets Received.

Item.Name: Multicast Packets Sent
Item.Description: Count of Multicast Packets Sent.

Item.Name: Multicast Packets Received
Item.Description: Count of Multicast Packets Received.

Item.Name: Broadcast Packets Sent
Item.Description: Count of Broadcast Packets Sent.

Item.Name: Broadcast Packets Received
Item.Description: Count of Broadcast Packets Received.

Item.Name: Start
Item.Description: Reset all resources and start collection period.

Item.Name: Stop
Item.Description: Stop collecting information, but do not reset resources.

Item.Name: Timestamp
Item.Description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed.

Item.Name: Fractional Timestamp
Item.Description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms).

Item.Name: Measurement Quality Indicator
Item.Description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

Item.Name: Measurement Quality Level
Item.Description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.
